I'm not a #HarryPotter fan, and given the obvious problems with the creator, I wouldn't touch #HogwartsLegacy with a 40 foot pole anyway.

But holy crap the discourse, even here on the fediverse, from supposed "allies" who jump through mental hoops to justify contributing further to the #Hogwarts franchise.

I don't have the stamina to explain, to the level of detail I really want to, just how problematic contributing to that franchise is, how it demonstrates disregard for #trans people, and why it invalidates any status as an "ally." I've already spent three decades as a #queer activist fighting #homophobia and #transphobia … and the continued indifference of fair-weather "allies" is exhausting.

But a fantastic person went to that level of detail, in a video you should watch to understand why. Set aside the time, or watch it in segments, if you truly believe you are an ally:

https://youtu.be/_GBUArD51KY

@jerpirate @PixelAndPolyCurator This channel is the one I most recommend - he’s also got free resources on his website:

https://www.youtube.com/@SouthernGFX

title: Naomi Ceder: Farewell and Welcome Home: Python in Two Genders - PyCon 2014

last_post.content: Before you buy a ticket for this year's PyCon in Utah, please (re-)watch this talk https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4R6FXtZl154 and then ask yourself if you really want to spend your money in a state that looks at someone this brave, this strong, and this beautiful, and says, "Yeah, we think you should be illegal."

#TOcouncil thread: BUDGET DAY! 🧵

Today City Council does The Budget. The cost of COVID has left the City with huge holes in the budget that will be a challenge to fill. But the austerity budget is overshadowed by the revelation of the mayor's inappropriate relationship with a staffer and his promised (and, by some councillors, protested) resignation. This…complicates…the new "strong mayor" powers bequeathed by the Province that give the rest of Council limited ability to change the budget. Today will be a spicy one.

Inori Roy for The Local: https://thelocal.to/toronto-budget-2023/
Dave Rider, Ben Spurr, Alyshah Hasham for the Star: https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2023/02/10/a-serious-error-of-judgement-mayor-john-tory-had-relationship-with-staffer.html

Livestream link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eT2AfoqMw7A

title: How To Easily Find Your Twitter Network on Mastodon - STILL WORKING!

last_post.content:
TRYING TO FIND YOUR OLD TWITTER NETWORK?

After the great API shutoff, a lot of the services that people have been utilising to find their old Twitter networks no longer work.

Fedifinder is one of the few that is still up and running (I confirmed it myself this morning).

It isn't as seamless as some of the older methods, but can still be used in mere minutues to find users and easily follow them on Mastodon using the Import feature.

This video guide walks through the whole process from start to finish.

Please #Boost this to spread the word around your networks as much as possible. :ablobcatbongopost:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=37S246Wr_JE

#Fedifinder #MastodonTips #FediTips #TwitterMigration #Twitter

title: These Fossils Were Supposed To Be Impossible

last_post.content:
Charnwood Forest, Leicestershire, England, circa 560 million years ago. A fossil found here in 1956 by a local, Tina Negus, turned out to be the first solid evidence that complex lifeforms existed before the Cambrian Period. Subsequent discoveries hint that the site was a deep-water environment hosting a myriad of organisms.

Watch the video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ipkBmbi6k5c

The Topos Institute is starting a book club for Eugenia Cheng's marvelous intro to category theory! They'll go at a rate of one chapter per week, and you're all invited to submit questions. Eugenia Cheng will make a video each week addressing the questions for that chapter. Questions on chapter 1 are due February 19th.

Questioners will remain anonymous, so don’t hesitate to ask questions that might feel “stupid”.

For more about the book, try this:

https://youtu.be/96t4dFSm0Xk

(1/n)

And despite all the mentions of telephones and the internet, the very first song that appeared in my mind when I read the #JukeboxFridayNight theme was #Communication was "Message In A Bottle" by The Police.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MbXWrmQW-OE

Regarding the #HogwartsLegacy release...

If you want to live out a fantasy where you:
➡️ go to kings cross station
➡️ catch the train to the scottish highlands
➡️ wear a wizard hat
➡️ cast spells
➡️ find magical creatures
➡️ have a lightning logo ⚡

Then I highly recommend watching this video!
https://youtu.be/xvlsJ3FqNYU

It's basically the same thing, except it's made by a trans person 🏳️‍⚧️

#creativecoding + #cellularautomata

It's 2023 and I am uncomfortably excited about Depeche Mode and Orbital releasing new tracks. They're still so amazingly good.

Orbital just might be even better than ever.

Depeche Mode // Ghosts Again
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iIyrLRixMs8

Orbital // Ringa Ringa
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DNxGpMySziQ

Orbital // Are You Alive?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HisMjagjxHM

title: Project 86 "Fall, Goliath, Fall" official music video

last_post.content:
My background soundtrack when I'm replacing very old monolithic server environments.

We fight, not for the hate of a tyrant.
We fight, because of love for what is behind us.

#Project86 #music

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aKGtfOrtJ1s
